text: The Bahamas were first at the Olympic Games in 1952. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for the Bahamas is BAH. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Athletes from the Bahamas have been in every Summer Olympic Games since then, except the boycotted 1980 Summer Olympics. The nation has not been in any Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Bahamas is the Bahamas Olympic Association, and was formed in 1952. == Medalists == Medal Name Games Sport Event Sloane Farrington 1956 Melbourne Sailing Star class Cecil Cooke 1964 Tokyo Sailing Star class 1992 Barcelona Athletics Men's triple jump Eldece Clarke-Lewis Chandra Sturrup Savatheda Fynes Pauline Davis-Thompson 1996 Atlanta Athletics Women's 4×100 metre relay Chandra Sturrup Pauline Davis-Thompson Debbie Ferguson Eldece Clarke-Lewis 2000 Sydney Athletics Women's 4×100 metre relay 2000 Sydney Athletics Women's 200 metres 2004 Athens Athletics Women's 400 metres 2004 Athens Athletics Women's 200 metres 2008 Beijing Athletics Men's triple jump Andretti Bain Michael Mathieu Andrae Williams Christopher Brown 2008 Beijing Athletics Men's 4x400 metre relay Michael Mathieu Ramon Miller Chris Brown Demetrius Pinder 2012 London Athletics Men's 4 × 400 metres relay ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== == Other websites == * Bahamas profile at London2012.com * Bahamas at Olympic.org Category:Sport in the Bahamas Category:Nations at the Olympics
title: Bahamas at the Olympics
